description: Writing Table (bureau plat); By Martin Carlin (French, born Germany, about 1730 - 1785, master 1766), At least seven plaques gilded by Jean-Baptiste-Emmanuel Vandé (French, 1716 - 1779), Sèvres Manufactory (French, 1756 - present); Paris, France; 1778; Oak veneered with tulipwood and set with 14 soft-paste porcelain plaques with bleu céleste ground color, polychrome enamel decoration, gilding; set with gilt bronze mounts, modern leather top; 77.5 × 131.1 × 61.9 cm (30 1/2 × 51 5/8 × 24 3/8 in.); 83.DA.385; J. Paul Getty Museum, Los Angeles, California
